result.execSummary:
The defendant Cortez W Shields was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
IMPOSED & STAYED.
5/11/17 Crt orders def is eligible for ERP but not eligible for CIP.
Early termination at 5 yrs if PO Agent recommends.

miscConds.notes: Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.

No bars, taverns, liquor stores or any business where primary business is sale of alcohol.   Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with victim. If certified domestic treatment and remain sober, PO Agent can lift no contact ban.

First 3 yrs will be on sobrietor.  Completion of certified domestic violence treatment.  Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes: 30 hrs/wk if not working, school or treatment full time.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $368 paid in full from bond.
All other conditions are the same as count 1.

State asking for PSI. Crt has colloquy with def and accepts plea. Crt orders PSI. State requests bail be revoked, Atty Karpe objects. Crt questions counsel. Crt allowing BMP review. Bail revoked.

AMENDED CASH BOND - REFERRAL TO BMP - BOND IS REVOKED PENDING ACCEPTANCE INTO BMP
- Cash bail has been set in the amount of $1,000 (previously posted on 12-29-15 and held). The defendant is to be reviewed for eligibility for DCBM. If accepted, the defendant shall be released on a cash bond in the amount of $1,000 (per case).  DCBM should confirm the following:  Care ful review of BMP's ability to monitor defendant while he is awaiting sentencing - PSI Ordered.
-  If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Lashawn H. or any member of her immediate family.
- Defendant shall not be in the 5800 block of Russett Rd in Madison, WI., the 6700 block of Jacobs Way, 2900 block of King James Way, or at Journey Mental Health on W Washington or the Country Inn & Suites in Fitchburg.

Defendant in court with Attorney David Karpe.  Cara Throckmorton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ludwig hearing held, plead to count 1 and 2, dismiss and read in 3 and 4, free to argue.  Defense has rejected the offer.  Bailiff sent to get jury panel. Bailiff sent down to get jury panel.  Prospective jurors brought in, sworn at 9:41. Clerk calls 24 names. Court starts preliminary jury instructions. Court starts voir dire. Court strikes juror 310 at 10:11.  Clerk calls another name. Voir dire by ADA Throckmorton. Court strikes juror 311 at 10:21. Clerk calls another name. ADA Throckmorton continues Voir Dire. Court strikes juror 2 at 10:21. Clerk calls another name. ADA Throckmorton continues Voir Dire.  Voir dire by Atty. Karpe.  Strikes starting at 10:58.  Strikes done at 11:09.  Clerk calls 14 names.  Non selected jurors excused. Court finishes preliminary instructions.  Jurors excused at 11:15, to return Tuesday May 3, 2016 at 8:15.  Court adjourned.
